title: ESA Publishes Call for Reusable Rocket Booster Concepts
summary:
The European Space Agency has published a call for reusable rocket booster concept proposals that will allow Europe to develop “the necessary reusable transportation systems to achieve routine access to space.” The Boosters for European Space Transportation (BEST!) initiative is being managed by ESA’s Space Transportation Directorate under its Future Launcher Preparatory Programme (FLPP). According […]
The post ESA Publishes Call for Reusable Rocket Booster Concepts appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Greece signs Artemis Accords
summary: Greece became the latest country to sign the Artemis Accords outlining best practices for sustainable space exploration Feb. 9.

title: Axiom-3 Home at Last
summary: The four-person Axiom-3 private astronaut crew is home at last, days late because of poor weather in Florida. Their ride to and from the International Space Station was aboard a […]

title: Webinar: Automating for SmallSat Success

title: SpaceX Dragon capsule carrying Ax-3 astronauts safely splashes down
summary: The SpaceX Dragon crew capsule carrying the Axiom-3, or Ax-3, mission astronauts safely splashed down off the Florida coast this morning, returning...

title: The critical role of space in modern warfare and the imperative of joint space capabilities in Europe
summary: Lt. Gen. Steven L. Basham argues the importance of military collaboration in space with Europe to secure leadership.

title: Ax-3 private astronaut mission splashes down
summary: A SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft splashed down off the Florida coast Feb. 9, wrapping up a three-week private astronaut mission to the International Space Station.

title: Satellite operators join forces to chase direct-to-smartphone opportunity
summary: A group of satellite operators have joined forces to push the fledgling direct-to-smartphone market to adopt services using their radiowaves, rather than spectrum derived from terrestrial mobile network operators.

title: Beijing government releases commercial space action plan
summary: Beijing’s municipal government has released a set of policies to foster an innovative commercial space ecosystem in the city over the next five years.

title: Rocket Report: US military still wants point-to-point; India’s big 2024 ambitions
summary: "We’re still targeting to get Neutron on the pad before the end of the year."
